oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The Violet And A Rose - Little Jimmy Dickens performance - 1961-11-20 ; Second Hand Love Affair performance
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance of The Violet And A Rose, written by Mel Tillis, Bud Auge, and John Reinfeld, produced by Don Law and Frank Jones, recorded on November 20, 1961 at Bradley Film & Recording Studio in Nashville, TN, released by Columbia on July 6, 1962, and performed by Little Jimmy Dickens (vocal), Harold Bradley (guitar), Walter Haynes (guitar), Grady Martin (guitar), Joseph Zinkan (bass), Buddy Harman (drums), Cecil Brower (violin), Shorty Lavender (violin), Bill Pursell (piano), and the Jordanaires (background vocals). Performance of Second Hand Love Affair, performed by an unidentified male voice with band accompaniment.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Little Jimmy Dickens
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Little Jimmy Dickens performs "The Violet And A Rose" / (3:02) [Unidentified] performs "Second Hand Love Affair" [incomplete]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Tillis, Mel; Law, Donald F., 1902-1982; Jones, Frank, 1928-2005; Bradley Studios; Columbia Records, Inc; Dickens, Little Jimmy, 1920-2015; Bradley, Harold (Guitarist); Haynes, Walter; Martin, Grady, 1929-; Zinkan, Joe; Harman, Buddy; Brower, Cecil; Lavender, Shorty; Pursell, Bill; The Jordanaires
